articles.author: Beatrice Loayza
articles.title: ‘Three Minutes: A Lengthening’ Review: A Ghost Story - The New York Times
articles.description: Using footage from a three-minute amateur movie shot in 1938, this rousing documentary about a Jewish town in Poland is a haunting meditation on the memory of the Holocaust.
articles.content: Three Minutes draws from Kurtzs book, Three Minutes in Poland, which chronicles the authors efforts to identify the people in the film, many of whom ultimately perished in concentration camps. Stigte… [+859 chars]
